On september 19, 2012
Moderator

[ http://twinoid.com/en/article/3740/the-age-of-caushemesh ]

The universe of DinoRPG has evolved once more and this time we invite you to try out the biggest and best update since the game was launched!

Unsettling events are afoot, The Magnetic Steppes are covered in a strange fog.
If you have the Negative Lodestone Shard, you'll be able to ask the Rockies King what's going on...

  • An immense new quest leads you to far away lands and a new world.
  • The evolution of the maximum level of dinoz, the race is on to have the first level 60 dinoz.
  • An all-new skills tree featuring 78 new techniques with which to make your dinoz even more powerful.
  • The DinoRPG Master Pack is here, with the best deal around.
  • A brand new dinoz, the Etherwasp, makes a long-awaited entrance. Will you be able to find its invocation?
  • new magic objects are now available in the Dinotown shop.
  • A new system of FREE actions has been added allowing you to level younger dinoz more quickly.
  • A modification to the combat system, the energy gauge!
  • And a few more surprises for you to discover yourself...

May the spirit of adventure be with you!

No. Not even close.

They are not 24 hour timers. They are timers between 1 and 20 hours (inclusive). They are also not the same for all dinoz. So it is not at all the same. Think about it.

If you wanted to play every day at 18:00, then automatic actions timers like I suggest would let you do that every single day... except once every 6 days, you'd have to put up with having to play two turns for every dinoz at 18:00 instead of just one (assuming lv20+ dinoz). How is that a hardship? How is that not the pinnacle of flexibility? How would that not be the best turn system ever?

Sure if you have low level dinoz you'd get even more turns... and dinoz under lv12 would get two turns at 18:00 every day, if not played at other times. Still no downside... pick a time to play OR play when you can get online during that 20 hour window, either way, it wouldn't matter when the timers actually expire. You can't get more flexible than that.

As i see it the french server and this server have the same system. if you press the new turn button the timer will reset such that it expires at 0:00. thereby it does not matter when you press new turn. this is of course for lvl 20+ dinos.



I also prefer this new system (or old for other servers) over the 23h reset button. the reasoning for this is simple: if you are able to log on once a every 24 hours you will not lose a turn (this is timezone indepemdent).

In the 23h system you will lose time as soon as you can not log on at a fixed hour of the day. If you accumulate 24 hours of time lost over some time you lose a turn for all your dinoz. For me this meant I lost about 3% of my turns compared to other servers even though i should have had more turns on paper.

Imo the advantages of the 23h system are: you never have to lose a turn in the swamp and you can use the 47 houre rest method in any time zone.
But these do only affect single dinoz or a single group. So not losing a turn due to the system makes up for getting 21 times stuck in the swamp.

So correct me if I'm wrong but i think the one turn a day system is just superior to the old system. Of course i assume we can't gain a turn in the 23h system since usually people have to sleep .

Day 1 01:00 log on use your turn
Day 2 00:00 new turn activates
Day 3 00:00 counter reaches zero
Day 3 23:00 log on again, use active turn, then click new turn and use 2nd turn

So in this extreme case you did not log on for 71 hours but still got your two turns from days 2 and 3.

I have a couple of teams of lv17 dinoz and when their turn was up, the timer read 17hrs until next turn. i'm not complaining, that's a big improvement over what happened before but I never saw any announcement for that time frame. In other news, I'm surprised at the lack of awareness that surrounds these changes, by people who should know better: the changes aren't meant to accomodate any group of people (so yes, they won't be perfect for anyone), they're meant to change your behaviours as players.

More turns, scattered at different intervals among your dinoz means that people will check more often, login more often, and play more...thus increasing the potential that they actually spend more. That's fine, that's a good business practice - but it's still a game and cannot trump real life. If the complaint is that the game now interferes with real life because you have to stay competitive in the game...then you need to think about your life priorities, and be more competitive at being a better, more interesting person. Seriously.

Okij The timer always expires at reset for lv20+ now, no matter when you press the New Action button, and no matter when you take your turns. That means you can play once a day at any time you choose, without penalty or problem.

This system is better for those who are busy, and slightly worse for those who have no life.

[884682]

New action after 0000 for all dinoz (resting dino doesn't get a new action)

dinoz doesnt get new action at midnight, but get the possibility of getting a new action (means that they get the hourglass icon , and with that the possibility of gaining the action when you click on the new action button - and the important part is that they get their hopurglass even while they rest!

so:

- you put to rest your dinoz at 8:00 am
... resting ...
- at midnight the dinoz will get the hourglass icon (while resting)
.. still resting...
- next day at 11:00 pm you wake up your dinoz (stop resting). it rested 16hrs during the first and 23 hours during the next day)
- click on the new action button -> the dinoz gets a new action
- at midnight it will get another 'possibility' (nourglass/new action)...

so no action is lost, and it rested (a maximum of 24+23) hours..

important thing / change form the old system: you cannot do this at your chosen time, only at midnight! (put the dinoz to rest right after midnight and wake them up before midnight 2 days later!) - true, if you put your dinoz to rest right before midnight, then you will lose time from resting (to the maximum of 23 hrs of rest)

correct me if I'm wrong, but I think the system works like this..

On september 28, 2012
Mialmeri

Let me go straight to this.

Caushmesh is a changing world. This mean it change always. The magnetic rock(the center of the map).

This is the explanation: It has 4 "islands" and a rock in the center. (as you can see on the map). The only way to get from one island to another, is going through this stone.
However, you can't leave / return the stone when you wants, since it is only for 15 minutes around each island, and times are :

- Between 0 minutes and 15 minutes of every hour, 1st path is open to go and leave the stone.

- Between 15 minutes and 30 minutes of every hour, 2nd path

- Between 30 minutes and 45 minutes of every hour, 3rd path is open to go and leave the stone.

- Between 45 minutes and 60 minutes of every hour, 4th path is open to go and leave the stone.

From there, back to the 1st path possible and resume the cycle. Each reset changes the order of time that each "island" becomes accessible, but always completing cycles each hours.

I hope it helps you

[884682]

Unless Between 15 minutes and 30 minutes of every hour, 2nd path is the time you can't go or leave!
that is the case. in a given hour the path is open for 15 minutes to a place (one of the four). to both way. if you happen to go from the rock to ethereal well (I assume you are there ) and the timer clicks to the next quarter of the hour, then you will stuck there until the path opens again - in the next hour, in one of the quarters (Random). so, the worst case you went there in the first quarter, and can go back in the last quarter of the next hour..

gravity rock makes you move and have conversations real FAST! lol. if you cannot do the business at one place in 15 minutes, then you have to chill out for about an hour! a real killer for those, who want to click through a mission in 10 minutes.

[765481]

See the positive guys...
If grinding dark dinoz, you dont have to heal up.
If one of your dinoz dies: Angel potion, unrest, and fight on with 1 hp, wont make a difference Its not that hard to beat them before they attack, their initiative is miserably, as long as you got a fast team.
If you´re team isnt that fast... hmmm try around with grouping a slower one with faster ones, or just avoid the dark dinoz, xp are still generous in regions where no dark dinoz appear.
Last but not least, brave dinoz: Slower ones should avoid dark dinoz at all cost. Faster ones (wanwans, rockys for instance) wont have problems there since its 1on1, and their first 2 attacks should kill those pvp-defense-less guys nearly everytime.

[950547]

Well, initiative reducing lock-outs are still possible, so use your high lightning dinoz in the IDT... I gambled (and lost ) that flood spawning wouldn't happen anymore. Boy, was I wrong...
On october 5, 2012
njrules

Speed still counts, but you can't spam as much as you used too. You can still initiative lock but I do think it is more difficult now. Flood is very high cost, so you can't use it alot but vines are considered weak for the cost... so if you get a mix of them going you'll have time to replenish your blue bar and flood again.

Liquid Stumps and Detonation aren't as effective anymore as you take such a hit from using either of those that you risk losing a turn yourself, or are limited in what you can do after either is triggered.

I'm still not really sure how much endurance relies on speed to recover. Do others see the blue bar refilling faster with higher speed dinoz?
On october 5, 2012
HugoMVP

Well, it's definitely not as bad as before. I spammed a couple floods and vines on Songarian (fight) and he still managed to throw in some punches sometimes, I believe in the old mechanics I would have it totally dominated. Initiative skills are still important, but have less of an impact.

Don't judge some skills from 1vs1 (in dojo) and PVE. In 1vs1 many skills suck because the dino may run out of endurance fast, while in a group he can rest while the others attack. I saw situations like using vines and stumps in a turn, and then run out of endurance and the other dino attacks next like it was nothing (this really shocked me ). PVE I also belive gives a bad image, because monsters don't have endurance, so if you run out of it, monsters can get dangerous. 1vs1 in PVE is really hard now, imo... Poor brave dinoz :/

On february 6, 2013
[765481]

I made better experiences with pyramid interior, but thats definitely argueable, since i didnt compare both spots for a longer period of time.
So either way, pyramid is the way to grind if you cant defeat the dark dinoz without losses.

Regarding the 3 northern spots:
technodome and skull island spawn a mix of regular pve monsters and dark dinoz, so thats no good place to grind imho.
Example: Monsters with pvp defense tank your strongest attacks for 10 -20 damage, while a dark dinoz would have taken 200 damage. In the end, you "focuss" on the monsters, and the dark dinoz kills you.
So if you are strong enough to fight dark dinoz, go to the extraction complex. 2 dark dinoz per fight guaranteed.

On may 27, 2013
[895738]
poqemonany suggestions where (in Caushemesh) to fight with a group of 42? Thank you!

Personally, I'd suggest grinding with the dorogons at nimbao. , however, is quite varied, between 15-60 per dino. Depends on whether you meet the guards more often than the dragon dogs. loss also varies depending on team. With my experience, loss was around 0-30 as I specialize in initiative mainly.

As for carushmesh, it depends on the group's common strength, between reinforcements, initiative (both initial and reduction abilities), healing abilities and prevalence of tough A skills. If you have a strong initiative team, I'd recommend fighting the dark dinoz (do provide us results too). If you can't afford losing too much at once in fights, fight anywhere but the dark dinoz area and, hopefully, you encounter the groulems (with same defensive ability as eeloz) and rockballs. Their is around 90-120 for a group of 3, similar to that of grinding at summit at nimbao, fighting pink gromsters.

Speaking of gromsters, if you do send level 42 dinoz to carushmesh, you might find those chimcheres quite frequently (forgot their name), the carushmesh version of the gromster, but more resilient. I sent my wanwans to carushmesh at level 38-9 and they constantly encountered 1 chimchere, and they lost a lot of in fights. Again, if you have good initiative team with tough assaults, I recommend fighting the dark dinoz. If you have a low initiative team, you could rely on petrification and/or torch for additional damage and/or to paralyze the counter-attackers.
